title: [BUG] Crash on windows arm64 in a publish version
body:
### Description

Our application runs correctly in Debug and Release modes on Windows ARM64, but when creating a Publish build for Windows ARM64, the app starts but crashes immediately.

### Code

https://github.com/riccardomartins/ArmDemoTryout/tree/main/ArmDemoTryout

### Expected Behavior

Build the app in Release mode → works fine on ARM64.

Publish the app

Run the published executable → should work and run normally

### Actual Behavior

Build the app in Release mode → works fine on ARM64.

Publish the app

Run the published executable → crash in a Arm64 windows

### Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)

comments.author: riccardomartins
comments.body: I found out that by installing Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable that app works correctly in a fresh arm64 windows. Is this exptected?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Were you using the GPU rendering? If so, I am trying to release a fix for that.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Closing as fixed. CI on PR #3510 confirms that the ANGLE DLLs (`libEGL.dll`, `libGLESv2.dll`) do not depend on `VCRUNTIME` or `MSVCP` — they are already statically linked. #3510 adds build-time dependency verification to catch any future regression. This matches the reporter's finding that installing VC++ Redistributable resolved the crash.
